words.defineEn: resembling a tree in form and branching structure
words.defineVi: giống như một cái cây ở dạng và cấu trúc phân nhánh

examples: A huge percentage of the nation's fruits and vegetables, nuts, and beef come of this increasingly arid West.
Her native habitat is the arid regions of south central South America as opposed to eastern Brazil.
The habitat there consists of semi-arid forests, arid forests, and rocky deserts.
In an arid desert basin in Mongolia, around 30 million years ago, a very large mammal was on the lookout for food.
At the poles, lush ecosystems took hold, while parts of western North America became arid.
words.defineEn: (of land or a climate) very dry because of not having enough or any rain
words.defineVi: (của đất hoặc khí hậu) rất khô vì không có đủ hoặc không có mưa

examples: The office is fraught with danger.
But the road to a fairer census was still very fraught.
Big wave surfing and independent filmmaking is fraught with doubt, uncertainty about where the money is going to come from, and rejection.
From the very start of the pandemic she's made the politically fraught choices.
But restaurants have had a somewhat fraught relationship with delivery in recent years.
words.defineEn: filled with or attended with
words.defineVi: đầy với hoặc tham dự với

words.defineEn: artificial and inferior
words.defineVi: nhân tạo và thấp kém

examples: Three days later a rash appeared.
There is no rash.
I've already made a rash decision.
Tell us about the rash.
Ariana Hawk's son suffered from blisters and skin rashes.
words.defineEn: doing things without carefully thinking about the possible outcomes
words.defineVi: làm mọi việc mà không suy nghĩ cẩn thận về kết quả có thể xảy ra

examples: Minding your Ps and Qs in London is akin to respectful bows and nods in Singapore.
The woman's heart was filled with pity for the orphaned children, and as she spent time with them, she realized that pity is akin to love, and she became devoted to them.
It's probably more akin to the 1918 pandemic.
It really was akin in some ways to a campaign event, a political event, as much as it was a vetting of a judge.
It's a single-celled organism akin to a giant amoeba.
words.defineEn: similar in quality or character
words.defineVi: tương tự về chất lượng hoặc tính cách

examples: This is clearly not the case, so something must be amiss.
Did you have any warningthat anything was amiss?
So oftentimes new goldfish owners don't realize anything's amiss until it's too late, and common diseases like fin rot, white spot disease, and fungal infections have already taken hold.
But well before they have time to process what’s happened, millions sitting on their couches become aware that something is amiss.
words.defineEn: in an improper or mistaken or unfortunate manner
words.defineVi: trong một cách không đúng hoặc nhầm lẫn hoặc không may

examples: His family were very devout Catholics.
A devout Christian, he reasoned that Sundays were for spiritual worship.
Lam is a devout Catholic who grew up in a working-class area of Hong Kong.
I recently traveled to one of the most devout places in the country, Mississippi.
In ancient Kyoto, a devout Shinto scholar lived a simple life, but he was often distracted from his prayers by the bustling city.
words.defineEn: believing firmly in a particular religion
words.defineVi: tin chắc vào một tôn giáo cụ thể

examples: When attending a funeral, it's the done thing to dress in black or other somber colors.
Songs with dark somber lyrics are common all over mainstream music right now.
RALPH NORTHAM: You know, this was a somber day for Virginia, but it was a necessary day.
(somber music) How you doin'?
The time-honored tradition of casting back on the past 12 months at the close of the year is a somber occasion this year.
words.defineEn: dark and gloomy in color, especially gray or black
words.defineVi: màu tối và ảm đạm, đặc biệt là màu xám hoặc đen

examples: She's so prim and proper that I bet she's never even jaywalked before.
I've never dated someone who is so prim and proper before.
Prim: The second time they come through here, they're gonna come with a lot more confidence.
words.defineEn: exaggeratedly proper
words.defineVi: phóng đại thích hợp

examples: It’s okay to be earnest.
And it's sincere and it's earnest
Soon, papal documents and books of canon law were being burned by students during protests as earnest young Christian humanists vented their anger.
And it's sincere and it's earnest and it's unselfish.
The fact that leaders are saying so little means that there are earnest and really good negotiations happening behind the scenes.
words.defineEn: characterized by a firm and humorless belief in the validity of your opinions
words.defineVi: được đặc trưng bởi niềm tin chắc chắn và không hài hước vào giá trị của ý kiến của bạn

examples: Sunken eyes stared out of its gaunt face, which broke into a crooked smile.
Navalny looked gaunt with a shaved head, after losing weight.
The men became gaunt and listless, and showed a decrease in strength, heart rate, and body temperature.
The gaunt, exposed Christ is starkly contrasted with Mary’s flowing, billowing robes.
words.defineEn: (of a person) excessively thin as a result of a disease, worry or hunger
words.defineVi: (của một người) gầy quá mức do bệnh tật, lo lắng hoặc đói

examples: So, your plane food probably tastes more bland than it actually is.
It's kind of that bland paste.
Nothing like some bland grits to clean that palate.
DESIREE POLK-BLAND: All of these factors interfere with being a successful student.
Because he's the president and he looks like, he's bland.
words.defineEn: unremarkable and lacking in distinctive or interesting qualities
words.defineVi: không nổi bật và thiếu phẩm chất đặc biệt hoặc thú vị

examples: They've got suggestions galore.
The highways are a mad thatch of interstates, parkways, boulevards, and spurs, plus river crossings galore, each with its own virtues and inconveniences.
There are privacy issues galore with regards to how Amazon collects data and how they, in the case of facial recognition software, how they actually share it with other organizations.
words.defineEn: in great numbers
words.defineVi: với số lượng lớn

examples: Like other avant-gardes before it, surrealism drew inspiration from non-western or so-called primitive cultures which for them provided an alternative set of aesthetic and social values.
Corea was renowned for his avant-garde approach, and over his long career, he won 23 Grammy awards, the most for any jazz artist.
Impressionism was one of the first of a string of avant-garde art movements, each rejecting tradition and embracing the modern, promoting new ideas about what art could be and what it could do.
words.defineEn: innovative, experimental, or unconventional in style or approach, especially in the arts
words.defineVi: đổi mới, thử nghiệm hoặc độc đáo trong phong cách hoặc cách tiếp cận, đặc biệt là trong nghệ thuật

examples: It's also an obtuse angle.
For the next few minutes, the blob is sleeping in its obtuse triangle form.
This is obtuse, 110 degrees.
The angle is more Obtuse which indicates that the bullet is traveling much slower.
The obtuse triangle, which has an angle greater than 90 degrees, wakes up as usual and keeps growing.
words.defineEn: of an angle; between 90 and 180 degrees
words.defineVi: của một góc; giữa 90 và 180 độ

examples: And thus, the Gordian worm lives on.
Gordian worms seem to affect crickets' brains directly.
For example, this is the Gordian worm.
The Gordian worm needs water to mate, but the cricket prefers dry land.
words.defineEn: extremely intricate; usually in phrase `Gordian knot'
words.defineVi: cực kỳ phức tạp; thường trong cụm từ `Nút thắt Gordian'

words.defineEn: full of flavor
words.defineVi: đầy hương vị

examples: Then you have the aggressively vapid Daisy Buchanan, Nick's distant cousin who lives across the bay from Gatsby and Nick in the much more fashionable East Egg.
words.defineEn: lacking significance or liveliness or spirit or zest
words.defineVi: thiếu ý nghĩa hoặc sự sống động hoặc tinh thần hoặc niềm say mê

words.defineEn: struck with fear, dread, or consternation
words.defineVi: tấn công với nỗi sợ hãi, sợ hãi, hoặc kinh hoàng
